basics.name: Dezhi “Andy” Fang
basics.label: Computer Science Researcher & Software Engineer
basics.summary: Dezhi “Andy” Fang is a Computer Science student at Georgia Institute of Technology. Andy believes that computing is about empowering. He wants to help people make discoveries and make sense of the world by researching and developing methods and tools that amplify one’s limited cognition power with limitless computing possibilities.

work.summary: Research in data mining with professor Polo Chau
highlights: MMap: Scaling up scientific computation with memory mapping
ARGO: Billion-scale visualization of network data

work.summary: Utilizing data mining to improve maleware detection

highlights: Lead developer of a CMS for online education
Primary developer of an online coding practice platform http://lintcode.com
Built automated server cluster scaling system for distributed tasks
Built email marketing system now sending 50k+ emails per month
Maintained and updated internal infrastructure across multiple applications and distributed services including celery, memcached and nginx
Sole developer of claryfy.com, a web forum for international students built with Django and PostgreSQL
Built front-end of InitialView's Interview Booking System
Built front-end of InitialView Interview Player

awards.title: President's Undergraduate Research Award (PURA)
awards.summary: The Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program competitively funds individual requests by a student to support undergraduate student involvement in faculty research. Dezhi “Andy” Fang received PURA Travel Award funding to present at 2016 ACM SIGMOD/PODS @ San Francisco, USA. $500.

awards.title: Runner Up, Emory GCC Case Competition
awards.summary: Case competition focused on mobile payment industry. Developed strategy for a U.S. based company to enter China's market with NFC payment technology.

awards.summary: Case competition focused on Electronic Health Record (EHR) industry. Developed strategy for an established EHR company to transform its infrastructure to cloud-based solutions with high interoperability among EHR standards and medical devices.
